intro: Sutera multifida, commonly known as the fragrant leaf plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Sutera multifida is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its pleasant, spicy fragrance. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a versatile addition to gardens.
